newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech stocks highlight trading.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Tech stocks highlight trading.

text.p: With the technology sector lighting up an otherwise weak U.S. stock market, several technology stock options drew heavy interest Wedensday, traders said.

Options on shares of Cisco Systems Inc were among the most active around, led by the June 65 calls, which traded a total of about 13,675, nearly all of which crossed at the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE).
Cisco options also trade on the Pacific Exchange (PCX).
"We've had one customer in particular who's been an aggressive buyer of it," said Patrick Hamilton of LETCO, referring to the Cisco June 65 calls at the CBOE.
In afternoon trading, Cisco shares were up 3/4 at 65-1/8 on turnover of more than 13.8 million shares.
Hamilton said that in the last few sessions, an investor was a heavy seller of the Cisco June 65 calls, which drove implied volatility down to the mid-30 region by Wednesday afternoon.
"This is the low end of volatility spectrum in Cisco," he said. "I think that's why we're seeing the aggressive buyer in the 65s.
"He probably feels that volatility is pretty low and it's a good shot," Hamilton said.
He added that some of the other activity in Cisco options was a spinoff of the June 65 call action, with the buyer of the June 65 calls selling some June 55 calls, for instance.
Other busy Cisco options included the June 55 and 60 calls, the June 60 and 65 puts and the July 65 and 70 calls.

In other activity, Dell Computer Corp had a couple active options as the shares rallied sharply after the company reported late Tuesday strong quarterly earnings and announced a two-for-one stock split.
The Dell June 100 call traded 3,825 contracts and the June 105 traded about 3,600. The busiest put was the June 95, with turnover of nearly 2,000 contracts.
Dell stock surged 7-3/8 to 107 on roughly 11.8 million shares.
Michael Schwartz, a managing director at Oppenheimer & Co, said some of the Dell June 100 and 105 call activity could be an investor or investors rolling positions up to the higher strike price.
"They could be legging into a roll up because they're not being done as spreads," he said of the June 100 and 105 volume.

Schwartz added that an investor did a 15-point spread in Microsoft Corp LEAPS (long term anticipation securities) that expire in January 2000. The January 2000 85 call traded 5,490 contracts and the 100 call traded 5,890.
"It's an in-the-money spread so he's got a high probability that it will work out, except he's got to wait 969 days" until those options expire, he said.

Elsewhere, a buy-write on a million GTE Corp shares was done with the December 42-1/2 calls on the American Stock Exchange, Andrew Schwarz at AGS Specialist Partners said. The December 42-1/2 calls traded 10,000 contracts.
